column2: unary mekso operator: immediately convert number into a single digit.
immediately convert symbolic string to number (explicit)
mekso operator/function terminator (in Polish notation): inserts exactly enough "{boi}"'s consecutively so as to terminate the most recently uttered operator/function in a mekso expression
column3: Encloses the operator and all of its explicitly mentioned operands within a pair of mekso parenthesis ({vei} and {ve'o} respectively).  All operand slots that have not already been explicitly filled are now (implicitly) filled by the default operand, {xo'ei} (which itself is taken to behave in its default mode), or the identity element under that operator/function in that position/role (in the sense that 0 or 1 is identity under exponentiation as the position/role of being the base but only 1 is identity for exponentiation in the exponent position/role).  Operators of arbitrary arity (such as {su'i}) are terminated immediately after the most recently explicitly mentioned operand. If the character string/digraph "eu" (and a corresponding diphthong) ever becomes valid in Lojban, .krtisfranks. asks that the meaning of this word be transferred wholly intact to "{boi'eu}" and that then this word be(come) unassigned.

column2: preserve formal interpretation of mekso subexpression with no substitutions made
column3: In a sense, "converts" an expression from one that has been tampered with in any way to exactly what was uttered in the first place. See: http://mw.lojban.org/papri/Proposal:_distinguishing_digits_from_numbers#Avoiding_the_.22.22D.22_Equals_.229.22.22_hole

column2: explicit "mu'o'u"-orientation marker
column3: Must be adjacent to at least one "{mu'o'u}". It 'walls off' that "mu'o'u" from applying to a quotation on the other side of this word; by the nature of "mu'o'u", this word should be elidable when two "mu'o'u"s are mutually adjacent (if this word were to be absent) or when there is no more than one quotation which is adjacent to the "mu'o'u" in question (if this word were to be absent), or when there is no "mu'o'u"; it is mandatory when it is not elidable. Example: in "lu X li'u mu'o'u lu Y li'u", it is not clear which quote (and, more specifically, which end of which quote) is being modified by "mu'o'u" - in this case, "boi'o'u" is mandatory; in "lu X li'u boi'o'u mu'o'u lu Y li'u", the "mu'o'u" applies to the quote with Y; in "lu X li'u mu'o'u boi'o'u  lu Y li'u", the "mu'o'u" applies to the quote with X; in "lu X li'u mu'o'u (boi'o'u) mu'o'u  lu Y li'u", the first "mu'o'u" applies to the quote with X, the second to the quote with Y, and this word is not necessary (marked via parenthesis).

column2: pro-sumti: definitional terbri variable 4; $x_4$
column3: May be used to define words with {cei'e}, or to talk about definitions of existing or proposed words. Series: {bo'a} {bo'e} {bo'i} {bo'o} {bo'u}

column2: attitudinal: \n{bo'oi} - silliness\n{bo'oinai} - maturity
column3: Expresses silliness, similar to one sense of ":P" (another sense being "zo'o"). What the speaker said is intended to be interpreted as being silly (not necessarily the same as humorous). Based on bebna and zo'o. See also {zo'o}, {bebna}

column2: pro-sumti: definitional terbri variable 5; $x_5$
column3: May be used to define words with {cei'e}, or to talk about definitions of existing or proposed words. Series: {bo'a} {bo'e} {bo'i} {bo'o} {bo'u}

Brasilia.

column3: Also: $x_3$ are related by relation $x_2$ (= {terbri} for reordered places).  ($x_3$ is a set completely specified); See also {sumti}, {fancu}.

4th assignable variable predicate (context determines place structure).

$x_{1}$ pertains to the Buddhist culture/religion/ethos in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is an amount of cloth/fabric of type/material $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is foggy/misty/covered by a fog/mist/vapor of liquid $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ (def. 1) local weight unit(s) [non-metric], standard $x_{3}$, subunits [e.g. ounces] $x_{4}$.
column3: (additional subunit places may be added as $x_5$, $x_6$, ...); See also {grake}, {junta}, {tilju}, {rupnu}, {fepni}, {dekpu}, {gutci}, {minli}, {merli}, {kramu}.

convert any single word to BY.
logically quantified predicate variable: some selbri 1.
logically quantified predicate variable: some selbri 2.
logically quantified predicate variable: some selbri 3.

attitudinal contour: 
{bu'o} - start emotion
{bu'ocu'i} - continue emotion
{bu'onai} - end emotion.
location tense relation/direction; coincident with/at the same place as; space equivalent of ca.
letteral for b.

modal aspect: actuality/ongoing event.
$x_1$ is a predicate word defined as such by its word shape, signifying relation $x_2$ (n-ary property) in language $x_3$
column3: In Lojban, this encompasses {gismu} + {lujvo} + {zi'evla}, but excludes pro-bridi, which are {cmavo}.

column2: $x_1$ is a $x_2$osity, a $x_2$onger, an absolute $x_2$ I tell you (augmentative)
$x_1$ (quoted text) is a “bu letteral” of character $x_2$ (zoi quote).
$g_1$ prepares/readies $b_1$ for $b_2$.
$j_1$=$b_1$ is almost ready for $b_2$ (event).
$x_1$ perceives that $x_2$ is the case (inference from perception).
$x_1$ (predicate) is true when applied to argument list $x_2$ (sequence)
column3: Synonymous to {zilbri}. The x1 slot can be filled with a property/relation (ka) whose number of free slots match the length of the sequence x2. It can also be filled with a bridi abstraction (du'u) —nullary predicate—, in which case the x2 should be the empty set or possibly {zi'o}. See also {bridi}.

column2: $x_1$ knows what sumti satisfies the predicate $x_2$
$x_1$ is a pro-bridi representing predicate relationship $x_2$ with relation $x_3$ among arguments $x_4$.
$x_1$ is a prenex of bridi/predicate relationship $x_2$ with relation $x_3$ among arguments $x_4$.
$l_1$ [rules/methods] is a predicate logic for deducing/concluding/inferring/reasoning to/about $l_2$ (du'u) with predicate relationships $b_1$.

$x_1$=$c_1$ (zo) is a cmavo with a predicate role or semantic structure which expresses predicate $x_2$=$b_1$ (quote/du'u) between arguments $x_3$=$b_3$ (ordered list), the said cmavo being of form or in category/class $x_4$=$c_2$ in/and belonging to language/dialect $x_5$=$c_3$.
column3: Includes "moi", "du", and any mekso cmavo for a function/operator.

column2: $x_1$ is a person who has a body that expresses predicate relationships.
$x_1$ is a bridi-tail of predicate relationship $x_2$ with relation $x_3$ among arguments (sequence/set) $x_4$.
$c_1$ is a question asking for a predicate, asked by $c_3$ to $c_4$.
column3: In Lojban, this is a question using the word “{mo}”.

column2: $x_1$ asks $x_3$ what arguments satisfy the predicate $x_2$
$x_1$ asks $x_2$ what sumti satisfies the predicate $x_3$
$x_1$ (text) represents a predicate relationship with relation represented by $x_2$ (text) among referents of $x_3$ that are arguments (sequence/set of texts).
column3: {bridi}, {selbri} and elements of {terbri} are referents of {brisni}, {selbrisni} and elements of {terbrisni} respectively.

column2: $x_1$ is a subsentence of Lojban grammar.
column3: A subsentence of the official Lojban grammar is put in NU-clause, NOI-clause or gek-gik-clause. The form is similar to a sentence of Lojban grammar, but subsentences cannot be connected to each other by afterthought connectives. See also {brisni} and {simsa}.

column2: $x_1$ induces from their auditive perception that $x_2$ is the case.
$v_1$ is a morphologically defined predicate word signifying relation $b_2$ in language $v_3$.
column3: Derived from {bridi} and {valsi}, deleting $b_3$, as we are speaking of the relationship independent of particular arguments.  In Lojban, such words must end in a vowel and contain a consonant cluster within the first five letters (not counting y).  Not all words that can be used as a selbri (for instance members of GOhA) are brivla.

column2: $c_1$ (quoted word(s)) is a name of $c_2$ used by $c_3$ that morphologically [strict] is brivla $bv_1$ in language $x_5$
column3: The name must strictly be a (sequence of) brivla (according to rules for language x5); as such, in Lojban, the word(s) c1 must end with vowels and in fact must exactly follow the morphology of brivla. See also: {brivlasmicme} (a specialization); {jvocme} (a different specialization that is analogous but restricted to Lojbanic lujvo).  Language is specified to be x5 rather than bv_n because the definition for {brivla} has not yet gained consensus and this particular terbri is dependent thereupon.

column2: $x_1$=$c_1$=$s_1$ (quoted word(s)) is a name of $x_2$=$c_2$ used by $x_3$=$c_3$ that morphologically [loose] evokes/is similar to/is a brivla $x_4$=$v_1$=$s_2$ (text; may be multiple words), similar in property/quality[/amount?] $x_5$=$s_3$ (ka/ni), in language $x_6$
column3: s3 will likely just be morphological structure. Strict brivlacme are a subclass of brivlasmicme.  The name must "look like" a (sequence of) brivla (according to rules for language x6), but need not exactly follow the morphological requirements thereof (in particular, c1 may end with a consonant in Lojban). See also: {brivlacme} (a specialization); {jvosmicme} (a different specialization that is analogous but restricted to Lojbanic lujvo).  Language is specified to be x6 rather than bv_n because the definition for {brivla} has not yet gained consensus and this particular terbri is dependent thereupon.

column2: $x_1$ is a brivla-based name for $x_2$ used by namer $x_3$
column3: {brivo} + {cmene}; see {brivla}. Syn. {brivlacme}. List of common brivycme: http://mw.lojban.org/papri/brivycme

column2: $n_1$ is Chanukkah/Hanukkah celebrated by $s_1$ with activities $s_3$

$x_1$ is a mass-individual (myopic singular, Mr Broda); $x_1$, or rather every individual among $x_1$, is logically an individual but represents a plurality and has the properties of what it represents
$g_1$ is Israel with people $g_2$ and land $g_3$.
$x_1$ is a menorah of material $x_2$ with lights $x_3$
$m_1$ is a synagogue at location/serving area $m_3$.
$xe_1$=$p_1$ is a Jew/Hebrew/Israelite.
$x_1$=$r_1$=$m_1$ is the First/Second Temple in judaism at location $m_3$.
$x_1$ is broccoli of variety $x_2$
$l_1$ (agent) sweeps/brushes $l_2$, removing soil/contaminant $l_3$ with brush $l_4$=$b_1$.
$x_1$ applies/brushes $x_2$ on surface $x_3$
$b_1$=$d_2$ is a drum brush for playing on drum/cymbal/gong [percussion musical instrument] $d_1$ with bristles $b_3$.
$x_1$ (quoted text) is a “bu letteral” of character $x_2$ (zoi quote).
column3: This term is specific to Lojban. A “bu letteral” is defined as one word which has been made to a letteral with “{bu}”. $x_1$ is a quote (eg. with {lu}…{li'u}) containing the “bu letteral” (including “bu”), $x_2$ quotes the character which the “bu letteral” stands for verbatim, which requires to use a {zoi} quote. See also: {lerfu}.

column2: $n_1$ is the Vesak celebrated by $s_1$ with activities $s_3$.
$c_1$ is a thread of fabric material $c_2$=$b_2$.
$f_1$ parachutes to $f_2$ from $f_3$ using parachute of type/material $b_2$.
$f_1$ is a tear in cloth $f_2$=$b_1$ of type/material $x_3$=$b_2$.
$g_1$=$b_1$ is a carpet/rug for covering floor $g_2$=$l_1$ of $x_3$=$l_2$, of type/material $x_4$=$b_2$.
$m_1$ is a tent sheltering $m_2$ from $m_3$, made of cloth $b_2$.
$m_1$ is a curtain/drape for covering $m_2$ and are made of cloth $m_3$=$b_1$.
$z_1$ is a tent for purpose $z_2$, made of $b_2$.
$v_1$ paraglides, using paraglider of type/material $b_2$.
$x_1$ is fog/mist of liquid/composition $x_2$ covering $x_3$.
$s_1$ is a brother's spouse of $m_2$ under law/custom/tradition/system/convention $sp_3$.
$n_1$ is brown bread made from grains $n_2$.
$g_1$ (agent) embarrasses/disconcerts $b_1$ about/under conditions $b_2$ (abstraction).
$x_1$ is the abstract color brown
column3: The gismu {burna} refers to objects which are brown, but not the color brown itself.  This lujvo serves the latter purpose.  See also {skari} {zilska}. EDIT: That should actually say "{bunre}", but I typed in "{burna}" because I'm an idiot.  I didn't correct it in making this edit because the irony is magnificent.

column2: $z_1$ is an awning over $z_2$, made of $b_2$.
$z_1$ is a tent inhabited by $z_2$, made of $b_2$.
$g_1$ (agent) turns device/apparatus $g_2$=$cab_1$=$can_1$ off.
column3: See also: turn on (={narca'acadgau}), turned off (={ca'arcando}).

$cl_1$ is unaided by/without apparatus/mechanism/device/equipment $ca_1$=$cl_2$ for function $ca_2$ controlled/triggered by $ca_3$ (agent).
$x_1$ (nu) happens far away in time from $x_2$ (nu).

$x_1$ (text) is an abbreviation, short form of word or phrase $x_2$ (text)
column3: Newer version of the obsolete form {brevia}.

column2: $x_1$ is the relationship between $x_2$, $x_3$, $x_4$, ...
column3: ko'a mo ko'e ko'i ... = "ma brididu ko'a ko'e ko'i ...", which is the way that English expresses the concept of Lojban {mo}. See also {bridi}, {du'u}, {mo}.

column2: $x_1$ is a quantity of Brie cheese of variety $x_2$.
$x_1$ is a part of Lojban text representing rule 'bridi-tail' according to the first edition of the book 'The Complete Lojban Language'.
column3: Inner structure of the rule: bridi-tail-1 (gihek stag? KE # bridi-tail /KEhE#/ tail-terms)?. For the description of the syntax see {jarnezi}.

column2: $x_1$ is a part of Lojban text representing rule 'sentence' according to the first edition of the book 'The Complete Lojban Language'.
column3: Inner structure of the rule: (terms (CU #)?)? bridi-tail. For the description of the syntax see {jarnezi}.

column2: $x_1$ is a part of Lojban text representing rule 'subsentence' according to the first edition of the book 'The Complete Lojban Language'.
column3: Inner structure of the rule: sentence | prenex subsentence. For the description of the syntax see {jarnezi}.

column2: $x_1$ is a part of Lojban text representing rule 'prenex' according to the first edition of the book 'The Complete Lojban Language'.
column3: Inner structure of the rule: terms ZOhU #. For the description of the syntax see {jarnezi}.

column2: $x_1$ is eggplant, aubergine of variety $x_2$
$x_1$ is a brochure about $x_2$; $x_1$ is paper document informing about $x_2$
column3: Brochure can be folded into a template, pamphlet or leaflet.

column2: $x_1$ is a broccoli of variety $x_2$
$x_1$ is a bromeliad/pineapple of species $x_2$.
$x_1$ is some broth, liquid (usually water) in which food (meat or vegetable etc) has been boiled.
$x_1$ exhibits spina di pesce/Brunelleschi herringbone (zigzag) pattern/design with features $x_2$
column3: Something as simple as the alternating count or specification of the spines can be described in x2 (in other words, the description need not be complete). See also: {zigzagi}.

column2: $x1$ is a buddhist monk of sect $x2$
$x1$ is a buddhist nun of sect $x2$
$x_1$ is an amount of gingham
$x_1$ is a quantity/is made of gingham.
$x_1$ is a boulevard
$x_1$ is a rifle/long gun
$x_1$ is the boogaloo, danced by $x_2$ to music $x_3$
$x_1$ is a burger/hamburger.
$x_1$ is a bourgeois, a capitalist who engages in industrial commercial enterprise $x_2$
Bucharest, capital city/a major city of Romania.
Brother
naturalistic interjection: used to express a fit of overwhelming or uncontrollable laughter; the stereotypical 'evil laugh'
column3: Additional -'a syllables may be added as desired. See {u'i}, {le'o}, {xa'a}, {cmila}, {palci}

column2: abstractor: abstractor to create logically quantified selbri variable to be used in predicate logic of third or higher order.
column3: {zo'e} and {da} are a constant and a bound variable of predicate logic of first order respectively; {co'e} and {bu'a} are a selbri constant and a bound selbri variable of predicate logic of second order respectively; in order to express predicate logic of third or higher order, it is essential to have selbri that treat selbri variables in the domain of all selbri of second order. {su'u} and {bu'ai} in selma'o NU can compose respectively a selbri constant and a bound selbri variable in the domain of all selbri of second order. In the case that {bu'ai} takes plural number of selbri variables, connect them with {ju'e} or something. Higher order is also possible by nesting {bu'ai}. Example: su'o bu'ai xe'u kei su'o bu'a ro da zo'u bu'ai da bu'a (This {xe'u} is an abstraction-variable-indicator-{selbrisle} used in order to put a word of selma'o NU in prenex.) See also {su'u}, {bu'a}; {xe'u}.

column2: Buenos Aires.

attitudinal contour: 
{bu'o } - start emotion
{bu'o cu'i} - continue emotion
{bu'o nai} - end emotion.
$x_1$ is a part of Lojban text representing rule 'lerfu-word' according to the first edition of the book 'The Complete Lojban Language'.
column3: Inner structure of the rule: BY | any-word BU | LAU lerfu-word | TEI lerfu-string FOI. For the description of the syntax see {jarnezi}.

column2: $x_1$ happens now
$x_1$ is modern in aspect $x_2$
Brunei.
Brooklyn, New York: a borough of New York City, at the western tip of Long Island.
elliptical/unspecified/vague letteral/symbol
column3: Has use in mekso at the least; in this context, it might subsume {xo'e} (but see: {xo'e'o'e}). It also may be useful in spelling, initialisms, etc. If used as a pro-sumti (as other letters are), it means {zo'e} but only for reasonable or previously specified letterals assignments.

column2: Interjection: Boo!
column3: A way to shock people analogous to yelling "BOO!" at someone.

column2:
attitudinal contour: 
{bu'o } - start emotion
{bu'o cu'i} - continue emotion
{bu'o nai} - end emotion.
digit/number: eighteen (decimal 18).
Refers to what is usually assumed to be the argument of tense tags when no explicit argument is given
column3: Usually, {pu} {ca'au} means the same as {pu} {ku}. What {ca'au} refers to depends on the bridi operators before it.

column2: $x_1$ exhibits spina di pesce/Brunelleschi herringbone (zigzag) pattern/design with features $x_2$
column3: Something as simple as the alternating count or specification of the spines can be described in x2 (in other words, the description need not be complete). See also: {zigzagi}.

column2: time tense: has been, is now in the aftermath of; (tense/modal).
$x_{1}$ is current at/in the present of/during/concurrent/simultaneous with $x_{2}$ in time.
column3: (default $x_2$ is the present resulting in:) $x_1$ is now; time relationship only, 'aorist' claiming simultaneity does not mean one event does not extend into the past or future of the other. See also {zvati}, {balvi}, {purci}, cmavo list {ca}, cmavo list {ca'a}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is apparatus/mechanism/device/equipment for function $x_{2}$ controlled/[triggered] by $x_{3}$ (agent).
column3: Form determined by/from function; does not imply automated/automatic action - requires an external agent/trigger (a minji may be a zmiku cabra if it requires an external agent to trigger or control the functions that it performs automatically).  (cf. {tutci}, {minji}, {finti}; {girzu}, {ganzu} for organizational apparatus, {pilno})

column2: $x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ hours in duration (default is 1 hour) by standard $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ walks/strides/paces on surface $x_{2}$ using limbs $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ (event) often/frequently/commonly/customarily occurs/recurs by standard $x_{2}$.
column3: See also {rirci}, {fadni}, {kampu}, {rapli}, {krefu}, {lakne}, cmavo list {piso'iroi} and similar compounds.

column2: evidential: I define.

$x_1$ (abstraction) should/(of right) ought to be true/happening under conditions/in the case of $x_2$ being true/happening, as believed by/by standard/under consideration of $x_3$. If the world were proper/correct/just/ruled perfectly and strictly according to $x_3$ and if $x_2$ were true, then $x_1$ would be true as well.
column3: Moral judgment goes in $x_3$. $x_3$ can also be assumed by expectation under hypothesized laws of physics, by the true situation of the world, etc. Synonymous with {zgadi}.

column2: $x_1$ is a shaman/medicine man of group/tribe $x_2$
column3: Refers to the religious practices and their practitioner.

column2: $x_1$ is a wound on body $x_2$ at locus $x_3$ caused by $x_4$
column3: Unlike velxai, it's specific to physical injuries pertaining to the surface of an organic body such as skin. Open wounds include ka'arcagna for "incision / incised wound", fercagna for "laceration", gukcagna for "abrasion", tuncagna for "puncture wound", grecagna for "penetration wound", batcagna for "bite wound", dancagna for "gunshot wound", jelcagna for "burn", da'ercagna for "bedsore", furcagna for "necrosis"; closed wounds include daxcagna for "contusion/bruise", camdaxcagna for "hematoma", ra'ircagna for "chronic wound".

column2: $d_1$=$c_1$ is today; $d_1$=$c_1$ is the day occuring at the same time as $c_2$, day standard $d_3$.
$x_1$=$ce_1$=$ca_1$ is this morning; $x_1$=$ce_1$=$ca_1$ is the morning occuring at the same time as day $x_2$=$ce_2$=$d_1$ at location $x_3$=$ce_3$.
$d_1$=$c_1$=$x_1$ is the today daytime period of $c_2$=$x_2$ at location $n_3$=$x_3$.
column3: Usage rules are exactly analogous to those of "{cabycte}". This is the diurnal period which ranges from morning/sunrise until dusk/sunset for the calendrical or circadian rhythm (or similar) full day which the speaker, via $x_2$ and $x_3$, considers to be 'today'.

column2: $x_1$ (nu) happens nearby in time from $x_2$ (nu).
$j_1$=$c_1$ is this week; $j_1$=$c_1$ is the week occuring at the same time as $c_2$, week standard $j_3$.
$x_1$ overlaps in time and space with $x_2$
$m_1$=$c_1$ is the current month by month standard $m_3$, simultaneous with $c_2$ in time.
$x_1$ is the $x_2$-th one timewise to satisfy property $x_3$ among $x_4$.
$n_1$ is the current year by standard $n_3$, simultaneous with $c_2$ in time.
$x_1$ is extinct/no longer existent.
$x_1$ watches the event $x_2$ unfold before their very eyes/live/red-handed/in flagrante (delicto), using senses/means $x_3$.
column3: No implication of the action being considered improper or discouraged. The event must be an action (lo nu {zukte}), not just an occurrence. "Before one's very eyes" is an idiomatic expression and does not require sight to have been involved, nor $x_1$ to even have eyes.
column5: catch in the act;in flagrante;in real time;live;red-handed

column2: $x_1$ is the last one timewise to satisfy property $x_2$ among $x_3$.
$x_1$=$v_1$=$c_1$ is this evening; $x_1$=$v_1$=$c_1$ is the evening occuring at the same time as $x_2$=$v_2$ at location $x_3$=$v_3$.
$ce_1$ is the modern era.
$n_1$=$c_1$ is the night of $c_2$ at location $n_3$.
column3: {cabycte} is tonight, whether or not it is currently night yet. {bavlamcte} is tomorrow night, even if {cabycte} is still in the future. See also {nicte}, {bavlamcte}, {prulamcte}, {cabdei}.

column2: $c_1$=$f_1$ is live (experienced as it happens) to experiencer $c_2$.
$k_1$=$c_1$ ranges through time/has duration $k_2$=$c_2$.
column3: $x_2$ is the complete duration as the amount of time or an interval specification and is non-aorist. Cf. {temci}.

column2: $x_1$ is the status quo/current state of $x_2$
$k_1$=$t_1$ is a tradition/practice/custom of traditional culture $t_2$=$k_2$ under conditions $t_3$
column3: This is similar to {ritli}, but the emphasis is not necessarily on particular rituals, but customs (ex. wearing of a particular type of clothing or hairstyle) associated with a group.

column2: $x_1$ habitually uses $x_2$ to do $x_3$; $x_1$ is a "user" of $x_2$.
$x_1$ (number) is the minute/minute notation of the hour, of event/state $x_2$, in system $x_3$.
column3: {cacra} zei {mentu} zei {tcika}. As default, the number $x_1$ is counted from the first minute of the hour. See {ti'u'e} for BAI. ex.) li cino cu cacryme'utcika lo nu mi ti xrukla kei py sy ty (I will be back at thirty minutes past the hour PST.)

column2: $x_1$ is $x_2$ long local distance units/miles per hour (mph) in speed/velocity.
$x_1$ is $x_2$ hours in angular measure of right ascension RA (default is 1).
column3: Cf. {cacra}, {radno}, {julra'o}, {sostartai}. {pi'e} used in x2 indicates a base of 60.

column2: $j_1$=$t_1$ is a convention prescribing $j_2$ (event/state) within community $j_3$=$t_2$.
$c_1$=$t_2$ customarily expresses $c_2$ to $c_3$ via medium $c_4$ under conditions $t_3$.
column5: customary expression;people who say things habitually; [people who say proverbs, (though that's more like se tcacyselsku)]

column2: $cat_1$=$can_1$ is a lurker/inactively watches $cat_2$
$k_1$=$c_1$ (agent) idly plays with plaything/toy $k_2$.
$s_1$=$c_1$ (agent) ceases and rests from activity/process/state $s_2$ (not necessarily completing it).
$x_{1}$ is heavy in proper mass, invariant mass, rest mass, intrinsic mass
$car_1$=$cat_2$ is a pushcart/wheelbarrow for carrying $car_2$.
$g_1$=$c_1$ pushes $m_1$=$c_2$ to destination $m_2$ from origin $m_3$ over path/route $m_4$.
$s_1$ is a valve/piston of material $s_2$, shoving/pushing $c_2$ at locus $c_3$.
$ca_1$=$t_1$=$cn_1$ is a/the mode [value that appears most often] in property/amount $cn_2$ (ka/ni) among $cn_3$(s) (set) by standard $cn_4$.
$r_1$ is a frequently-asked question about subject $r_2$
$x_1$ is a gas of $x_2$ at room temperature/STP.
column3: STP = standard temperature and pressure. See also {caflitki}, {cafsligu}.

column2: $di_1$ is a barn for storing/sheltering grains/livestock/tools/machinery $da_1$.
$n_1$ is a pasture with vegetation $s_1$ (mainly consisting of grasses) grazed by animal(s) $d_1$ belonging to farm/ranch $c_1$.
$b_1$ is a bandage, plaster or compress over wound $c_1$.
$x_{1}$ is a farming community with members $x_{2}$.
$c_1$ is an espresso machine controlled/[triggered] by $c_3$ (agent).
$x_1$ is modern in aspect $x_2$
time tense: present actuality; modal aspect.
time tense: is now/simultaneously, is now in the middle of; (tense/modal).
$x_1$ feels schadenfreude/pleasure derived from unfortunate/luckless event $x_2$.
discursive / expression: "If you say so"
$b_1$=$c_2$ is a wind from direction $b_2$ with speed $b_3$, shoving/pushing $c_2$ at locus $c_3$.
$l_1$ is liquid at room temperature/at standard temperature and pressure, and consists of composition/material $l_2$.
$x_1$ is a solid of $x_2$ at room temperature/STP.
column3: STP = standard temperature and pressure. See also {caflitki}, {cafygapci}

column2: $x_1$ is a livestock/farm-animal kept by $x_2$ of species $x_3$
$g_1$ is a/the agricultural industry/sector producing $g_2$=$c_4$ from farms $c_1$ located in $c_2$ farmed by $c_3$.
$x_1$ defines $x_2$ (nu/du'u) to be true / to happen // $x_2$ is true because $x_1$ says so or thinks so.
Evidential: "because I say so"/"because I assert it to be true"/"it is known".
column3: Maybe also "because I am your parent" in some contexts. The claim is true not because the utterer defines it to be so/has the authority or ability to make it so, but instead simply because they claim it to be true. Useful for dealing with annoying children who ask "why" iteratively; not useful for actually convincing anyone of the claim.
column5: because I say so;it is known

column2: shorthand for {ca lo nu}; during the event-of
column3: People who speak the dialect that uses {ca'ei} also use {pu'ei} and {ba'ei} for {pu} {lo} {nu} and {ba} {lo} {nu} respectively. Terminates with {ku'ei}.

column2: Unary mekso operator: unit vector/normalization of the argument (vector) X.
column3: Outputs X/|X|, where X is the vector-valued input; this is the unit vector which points in the direction of X. It might generalize to other tensors and the like. The definition of the magnitude/norm/metric is left to context or the explicit definition of the space in which X lives.

column2: evidential: I don't define
$x_{1}$ is made of/contains/is a quantity of chocolate/cocoa.
$x_{1}$ is a shell/husk [hard, protective covering] around $x_{2}$ composed of $x_{3}$.
{catni} modal, 1st place                            by authority of ...
attitudinal: strong intensity attitude modifier.
$x_1$ is a binary operator which is commutative in space/under conditions/on (or endowing) set $x_2$; $x_1$ and $x_2$ are each abelian (in different senses).
column3: Denote $x_1$ by "♤"; for any elements x,y in the set of concern, if '♤' is commutative, then x♤y = y♤x, where equality is defined in the space. "Commutative property"/"commutativity" = "ka(m)( )cajni". See also: {socni}, {sezni}, {dukni}, {facni}.

column2: $p_1$ is a farmer associated with farm $c_1$ producing $c_4$.
$z_1$ is a farmer's market selling $z_2$, operated by farmers $z_3$=$c_3$.
$b_1$=$c_1$ is huge/enormous/colossal in property $b_2$=$c_2$ to observer $b_3$=$c_3$.
$ci1$=$ca3$ feels passionate/is emotional about/feels strongly emotion $ci2$=$ca2$ about subject/event $ci3$=$ca1$
$cp_1$=$ca_2$ demands $cp_2$=$ca_2$ from $cp_3$.
$cu_1$=$ca_1$ (agent) permits/lets/allows $cu_2$ (event) under conditions $cu_3$, derived from authority on basis $ca_3$.
$cat_1$ stares at $cat_2$ as received by observer $car_3$.
$d_1$ craves/intensely wishes $d_2$ (event/state) for purpose $d_3$.
$j_1$ is a charge of service $j_2$ to consumer $j_3$=$c_2$ set and levied by authority $j_4$=$c_1$.
$x_1$ officially/authoritatively judges $x_2$ (event/abstract)
$z_2$ is official, approved by authority $z_1$=$c_1$ over sphere/people $c_2$.

$x_1$=$v_1$ is an authoritative document of $x_2$=$v_2$ (data/facts/du'u) about $x_3$=$v_3$ (object/event) preserved in medium $x_4$=$v_4$, by authority $x_5$=$c_1$ over matter/sphere/persons $x_6$=$c_2$ derived on basis $x_7$=$c_3$.
$x_1$ is an idol
$x_1$ officially approves $x_2$ (object / event); $x_2$ is official, approved by $x_1$
$n_1$ desperately needs/is desperate for $n_2$ for purpose/action/stage of process $n_3$.
$s_1$=$c_1$ is roaring/blinding to $s_2$ via sensory channel $s_2$=$c_3$.
$g_1$ is a/the wholesale/retail industry sector in which $c_1$ trades/barters $c_2 $ for $c_3$ by process $g_3$.
$x_1$ is a hostage of / is held hostage by $x_2$
column3: Other sumti slots may be needed. See also {pinfu}.

column2: $s_1$ (set) mutually exchange/trade/barter commodity $c_2$ for $c_3$ with $c_4$.
$x_1$ is a beetle of species $x_2$.
column3: Not to be confused with {ckacinki}; Cf. {kokcinela}, {kurkuli}, {gusycinki}.

column2: $x_1$ is a mollusk/clam/mussel/snail of species $x_2$.
$x_1$ is malacology based on methodology $x_2$.
$f_1$=$j_1$ is a quantity of chocolate mousse of composition including $f_2$=$c_1$=$j_2$.
$j_1$ is a quantity of chocolate pudding of composition including $c_1$=$j_2$.
$l_1$ is a chocolate drink/drinking chocolate/ is made of/contains/is a quantity of milk with added chocolate $c_1$.
$c_1$=$l_1$ is chocolate liquor, of composition including x2, under conditions x3.
$m_1$ is a quantity of/contains cocoa butter from cacao beans $m_2$.
$p_1$ is a cacao/cocoa powder/solids of cacao beans $p_2$.
$t_1$ is/are (a) cacao bean(s) of plant $sp_1$=$t_2$ (genus Theobroma; default T. cacao).
$x_1$=$d_1$ is an armoured fighter protected by armuor/shell $x_2$=$c_1$ covering $x_3$=$c_2$ of material $x_4$=$c_3$
column3: From {calku} (shell/armour) and {damba} (fighter). Does not imply full body armour.

column2: $p_1$=$j_3$=$c_3$ is mother of pearl from source $p_2$=$c_2$.
$j_1$ is a crustacean of species/class $j_2$.
$k_1$=$c_2$ is a tank/armored combat vehicle for carrying $k_2$, propelled by $k_3$, with armor-plating $c_1$.
$x_1$ is a turtle of species $x_2$.
$x_1$ is a calabash (hard-shelled gourd) of species or variety $x_2$
$x_1$ is voluminous by standard or relatively to $x_2$ (plural)

$c_1$=$d_1$=$m_1$ (space/volume/region/room) is $d_2$=$m_2$ cubic decimetres/decimeters ($m^3$) measured in perpendicular directions (triple)/defined by set of points (set)/occupied by $c_2$=$m_3$ by standard $m_4$.
$c_1$=$t_1$ is space-time occupied by $c_2$.
$x_1$ is a voxel of model/object $x_2$
$x_1$ is the geometric shape of $x_2$
$cm_1$ is a geometry describing $cm_2$=$ca_1$=$t_1$ geometric object.
$x_1$ is shaped (physically/geometrically) like $x_2$, with shape $x_3$
$p_1$ is a hologram/holograph on surface $p_2$ or projected from radiation source $g_3$ ; $p_1$ is holographic
$c_1$=$m_1$ (space/volume/region/room) is $m_2$ cubic metres/meters ($m^3$) measured in perpendicular directions (triple)/defined by set of points (set)/occupied by $c_2$=$m_3$ by standard $m_4$.
$cp_1$=$ca_1$ demands $cp_2$ from $cp_3$.
$g_1$=$c_1$ is vast/very wide in (2nd most significant) dimension $g_2$=$c_2$ with observer $g_3$=$c_3$.
$g_1$ is intensely happy about $g_2$.
$x_1$ concentrates on / pays close attention to $x_2$
$k_1$=$c_1$ screams/howls sound $k_2$.
$x_1$ loves (emphatically likes) $x_2$ (object/state)
column3: Made to include a use of the English word "love" that zo {prami} doesn't cover

column2: $x_1$ is authoritarian ideology of $x_2$; $x_2$ is authoritarian
$x_1$ is a bird/reptile egg (not simply the gamete) consisting of yolk $x_2$, white $x_3$ and shell $x_4$ of species $x_5$ (default chicken).
column3: Used particularly to refer to eggs that humans tend to eat, particularly chicken eggs, which is why the species place comes so late. Places for the major parts of the egg are included to make terms for "egg yolk" "egg white" and "egg shell".

column2: strong scalar intensifier: extremely...
time tense: during and after; (tense/modal).
Now. At the present time.
column3: The terminator {ku} is used to close the tense {ca}.

column2: sumti question asking for a time/date/event; simultaneous with what?.
$x_{1}$ vanishes/disappears from location $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ ceases to be observed at $x_{2}$ using senses/sensor $x_{3}$.
column3: Also leaves, goes away (one sense).  See also {cliva}, {ganse}, {zgana}, {lebna}, {vimcu}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is idle/at rest/inactive.
column3: “in motion”, not implying a change in location, is negation of this: {narcando}. See also {surla}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a farm/ranch at $x_{2}$, farmed by $x_{3}$, raising/producing $x_{4}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is agrarian.
column3: Also grange; farming is any organized agrarian activity, not limited to plant crops.  See also {purdi}, {nurma}, {ferti}, {foldi}, {xarju}.

column2: $x_{1}$ exchanges/trades/barters commodity $x_{2}$ for $x_{3}$ with $x_{4}$; $x_{1}$, $x_{4}$ is a trader/merchant/businessman.
column3: Also (adjective:) $x_1$, $x_2$, $x_4$ is/are commercial (better expressed as ka canja, {kamcanja}).  $x_2$/$x_3$ may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event (possibly service), or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {posycanja} for unambiguous semantics); (cf. {dunda}, {friti}, {vecnu}, {zarci}, {jdini}, {pleji}, {jdima}, {jerna}, {kargu}; see note at {jdima} on cost/price/value distinction, {banxa}, {cirko}, {dunda}, {janta}, {kargu}, {prali}, {sfasa}, {zivle})

column2: $x_{1}$ is a window/portal/opening [portal] in wall/building/structure $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is space/volume/region/room [at-least-3-dimensional area] occupied by $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a shovel/spade [bladed digging implement] for digging $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of sand/grit from source $x_{2}$ of composition including $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the gut(s)/entrails/intestines/viscera/innards/digestive system [body-part] of $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a cart/carriage/wagon [wheeled vehicle] for carrying $x_{2}$, propelled by $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is cyan/turquoise/greenish-blue [color adjective].
$x_{1}$ is food/feed/nutriment for $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is edible/gives nutrition to $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the knee/elbow/knuckle [hinged joint, body-part] of limb $x_{2}$ of body $x_{3}$.
column3: Metaphor: a sharp bend/curve. See also {korcu}, {jarco}, {jganu}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of hydrogen (H); [metaphor: light, flammable].
$x_{1}$ is an infant/baby [helpless through youth/incomplete development] of species $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the gland [body-part] secreting $x_{2}$, of body $x_{3}$; $x_{2}$ is a secretion of $x_{1}$.
(adjective:) $x_{1}$ is awake/alert/conscious.
$x_{1}$ repairs/mends/fixes $x_{2}$ for use $x_{3}$.
column3: A repair may be incomplete, fixing only one of the possible uses of $x_2$, hence $x_3$.  See also {cfila}, {spofu}.

column2: $x_{1}$ (person) explains $x_{2}$ (event/state/property) to $x_{3}$ with explanation $x_{4}$ (du'u).
column3: Explanation $x_4$ is an underlying mechanism/details/purpose/method for $x_2$ (= velcki for reordered places), generally assumed to be non-obvious; metaphorical usage with the various causal relations (i.e. jalge, mukti, krinu, rinka, nibli, zukte) is possible, but the non-obviousness, and the existence of an explainer with a point of view makes this word not a simple expression of cause.  See also {cipra}, {danfu}, {jalge}, {jinvi}, {krinu}, {mukti}, {nabmi}, {preti}, {rinka}, {sidbo}, {zukte}, {tavla}.

column2: (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is wild/untamed.
$x_{1}$ is moist/wet/damp with liquid $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ learns $x_{2}$ (du'u) about subject $x_{3}$ from source $x_{4}$ (obj./event) by method $x_{5}$ (event/process).
$x_{1}$ is a thread/filament/wire [shape/form] of material $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (property - ka) is a dimension of space/object $x_{2}$ according to rules/model $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is infinite/unending/eternal in property/dimension $x_{2}$, to degree $x_{3}$ (quantity)/of type $x_{3}$.
column3: Also everlasting, eternity, (= {cimnytei}), eternal (= {cimnyteikai} or {temcimni}). See also {vitno}, {renvi}, {munje}, {fanmo}, {sisti}.

column2: interval event contour: during ...; continuative                                    |-----|.
{ciste} modal, 1st place used in scalar negation    in system/context ...
digit/number: infinity; followed by digits => aleph cardinality.
$x_1$ is cute/adorable to $x_2$ in aspect $x_3$ according to aesthetic $x_4$.
$c_1$=$p_1$ intensely loves/feels strong affectionate devotion towards $p_2$ (object/state).
$ci_1$ is a fan of/intensely interested in $ci_2$ as received/measured by observer $ca_3$.
$g_1$ is a fanclub for $g_2$=$ci_2$.
$ci_1$=$m_2$ is toucan/toucanet of species/type $ci_2$ with bill $m_1$=$s_1$ of typically intense color or colors $s_2$=$ca_1$
$c_1$ effortfully tries to do $t_2$ by method $t_3$, as perceived by $c_3$.
$x_1$ is scarlet
$x_1$ is silicon.
$d1$ desires/wants/wishes vanishing/disappearance of $c1$ (event/state) for purpose $d3$.
$d_1$ is a sandbag with sand $d_2$=$c_1$, made of material $d_3$.
$x1$ is a hourglass measuring time units $x2$ to precision $x3$
$c_1$=$u_1$ is a window of user interface $u_2$.
$x_1$ is a hand of $x_2$ with joint fingers, either flat or with little curvature, with a spade-like shape.
$x_1$ is silicon (Si)
$r_1$=$c_1$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of sandstone of type/composition $r_2$=$c_3$ from location/source $r_3$=$c_2$.
$x_1$ is a sand desert
$g_1$ disembowels $c_2$=$b_2$.
$r_1$ defenestrates $r_2$ through window/portal/opening [portal] $c_1$ in wall/building/structure $c_2$
$g_1$ is a window frame of window $g_2$=$c_1$.
$x_1$ feels insecurity / feels threatened by threat $x_2$
$l_1$ is an adventurer traveling via route $l_2$ using means/vehicle $x_3$.
$x_1$ threatens $x_2$ with $x_3$ (danger, peril).
$b_1$ snarls/growls/roars the threat (utterance) of idea/action $s_2$ at audience $s_3$.
$s_1$=$c_1$ is an idea/concept/thought that is potentially harmful to $c_2$ under conditions $c_3$.
column3: The being put in jeopardy by the concept is not necessarily the thinker of the concept. For example, the concept of a certain type of terrorist act is not (only) dangerous to the would-be terrorist. 'Thought hazard' has a broader meaning than 'informational hazard' and 'knowledge hazard' ({capselju'o}, {junckape}, {capfatci} or {facyckape} – closely related words), which have to do with dangerous ideas that are true. [See Bostrom (2011).] Synonymous with {sibyckape}, which some may prefer.
column5: dangerous idea;dangerous thought;harmful idea;ideational hazard;thought hazard

column2: $s_1$ (agent) threatens/menaces idea/action $s_2$ to audience $s_3$.
$j_1$ is careful of $j_2$=$c_1$, which is dangerous to $c_2$ under conditions $c_3$
$x_1$ is a propeller
$b_1$=$c_1$ is a tornado/waterspout moving from direction $b_2$ at speed $b_3$ rotating around centre /eye $c_2$ with rotational  direction $c_3$.
$ca_1$=$cn_1$ is a drill [rotating, bladed digging tool] for digging $cn_2$
$l_1$ reels in $l_2$=$c_1$ by handle/at locus $l_3$ by rotating it around axis $c_2$.
$cr_1$=$ca_1$ turns to face $cr_2$.
$cu_1$ is a roller skate/ice skate for feet $cu_2$, of material $cu_3$, for carrying $x_4$=$ca_2$.
$k_1$ is $k_2$ (quantifier, default: one) cartloads/wagonloads in quantity.
$x_1$ turns $x_2$ around axis $x_3$ in direction $x_4$.
$k_1$ is a rotary saw [rotating cutting tool] cutting/splitting/dividing $k_2$ (object) into pieces $k_3$
$x_1$ drills material $x_2$ out of $x_3$.
$x_1$ is a Rubik's toy, being of shape/solid $x_2$ with sides $x_3$ and degrees of freedom $x_4$, made from/composed of $x_5$.
column3: This word may be mildly dispreferred to {carkemkasygaukepyblikemkeitci}. $x_2$ is not restricted to three-dimensional objects (despite the definition of {bliku}). Degrees of freedom should be descriptive (not just a number which counts how many there are); so, $x_4$ would be a list of possible moves available.

column2: $x_1$ is a Rubik's toy, being of shape/solid $x_2$ with sides $x_3$ and degrees of freedom $x_4$, made from/composed of $x_5$.
column3: $x_2$ is not restricted to three-dimensional objects (despite the definition of {bliku}). Degrees of freedom should be descriptive (not just a number which counts how many there are); so, $x_4$ would be a list of possible moves available.

column2: $x_1$ is a whirligig beetle of species $x_2$.
$x_1$ feels dizzy
$x_1$ is a champagne made from grapes $x_2$.
column3: Cf. {vanju}, {fomvanju}, {risyvanju}, {xalka}, {koinka}.  For sparkling wines without an AOC designation, use {fomvanju}.

column2: $x_1$ blackmails $x_2$ with activity $x_3$.
$x_{1}$ reflects the Shang Dynasty culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_1$ slaps $x_2$ with instrument or body part $x_3$.
$x_1$ is a complex number with argument $x_2$ and phase $x_3$
$x_1$ is temporally discontinuous; $x_1$ takes place in a non-continuous way, as a bunch of disconnected chunks.
Hong Kong.
Shanghai.
Contraction of ca'o co'a. Expresses that the event is progressively beginning.
column3: Instead of "mi ca'o co'a viska so'o dilnu", one can say "mi ca'o'a viska so'o dilnu".

column2: mekso 4-nary operator: spherical harmonics on colatitudinal/polar angle $a$ and azimuthal/longitudinal angle $b$ of unassociated order $c$ and associated order $d$.
column3: Usually denoted $Y^m_l (\theta, \phi)$. The Condon-Shortley phase must be prepended to the definition. The normalization is chosen so that the integral over all (solid) angles of $Y^m_l(\Omega) conj(Y^n_k(\Omega))  = \delta(m,n) \delta(l,k)$.

column2: binary operator: complex number from argument and phase, $(r, \phi) \mapsto r e^{i \phi}$
column3: For example, {re} {ca'oi} {pai} is −2, and {pa} {ca'oi} {vei} {pai}{fe'i}{vo} is about 0.7071 + 0.7071i.

column2: $x_1$ is a champagne made from grapes $x_2$.
column3: Cf. {vanju}, {fomvanju}, {risyvanju}, {xalka}, {koinka}.  For sparkling wines without an AOC designation, use {fomvanju}.

column2: space (character)
time tense: is going to, is now just about to, is now anticipating; (tense/modal).
$x_{1}$ is intense/bright/saturated/brilliant in property (ka) $x_{2}$ as received/measured by observer $x_{3}$.
column3: Also lustrous, gleaming, sparkling, shining (all probably better metaphorically combined with gusni: gusycai or camgu'i); in colors, refers principally to increased saturation (with opposite kandi).  See also {denmi}, {gusni}, {kandi}, {ruble}, {skari}, {tilju}, {tsali}, {mutce}, {blabi}, {blanu}, {bunre}, {cicna}, {crino}, {grusi}, {narju}, {nukni}, {pelxu}, {xekri}, {xunre}, {zirpu}.

column2: $x_1$ turns about vector $x_2$ towards direction $x_3$, turning angular distance / to face point $x_4$
column3: Also revolve (= {jincarna}).  See also {gunro}, {jendu}. New definition of {carna} originally proposed by Robin Lee Powell and backward-compatible with the old one. Official definition: $x_1$ turns/rotates/revolves around axis $x_2$ in direction $x_3$.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a chart/diagram/map of/about $x_{2}$ showing formation/data-points $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ rains/showers/[precipitates] to $x_{2}$ from $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is precipitation [not limited to 'rain'].
$x_{1}$(s) (mass normally, but 1 individual/jo'u possible) discuss(es)/talk(s) about topic/subject $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ [agent] shoves/pushes $x_{2}$ at locus $x_{3}$.
column3: Move by pushing/shoving (= {ca'ermuvgau}).  (cf. {danre} for non-agentive force, {lacpu})

column2: $x_{1}$ looks at/examines/views/inspects/regards/watches/gazes at $x_{2}$.
column3: Also look through (= {grecta}, {ravycta}, {bacycta}); note that English "look" often means a more generic "observe".  See also {jvinu}, {minra}, {simlu}, {viska}, {lanli}, {zgana}, {setca}, {viska}.

column2: $x_{1}$ has authority/is an official in/on/over matter/sphere/persons $x_{2}$ derived on basis $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ (agent) kills/slaughters/murders $x_{2}$ by action/method $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is shallow in extent in direction/property $x_{2}$ away from reference point $x_{3}$ by standard $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ launches/fires/shoots projectile/missile $x_{2}$, propelled by $x_{3}$ [propellant/propulsion].
column3: Also: $x_1$ is a gun/launcher/cannon; $x_1$ hurls/throws/casts (more general than renro in that propulsion need not be internal to $x_1$).  See also {renro}, {danti}, {jakne}, {jbama}, {spoja}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a community/colony of organisms $x_{2}$.
location tense relation/direction; forwards/to the front of ...
{claxu} modal, 1st place                            lacked by ...
non-logical connective: set link, unordered; "and also", but forming a set.
2-word letteral/shift: the word following indicates a new font (e.g. italics, manuscript).
$x_1$ is a helicopter for carrying $x_2$, propelled by $x_3$.
$x_1$ is a flywheel storing energy $x_2$.
column3: A flywheel stores energy by rotating.

column2: $m_1$ is a bike/bicycle/tricycle/pedal vehicle carrying $m_2$ in/on surface/medium $m_3$, propelled by force $m_4$ transmitted via pedal(s) $c_1$=$v_1$.
column3: Also include hydrocycle (={jaurcarvrama'e} or x3= "lo djacu"), handcycle (x4= "lo xance"), electric bicycle (= "lo carvrama'e be fo si'u lo dicymatra"; not to be confused with motorcycles), cycles with different numbers of wheels and different numbers of riders, etc.

column2: $c_1$ is a bike/cycle trailer for carrying $c_2$, propelled by bike/(moped) $l_1$=$c_3$.
$x_1$ is a rainforest
column3: Prefer the lower scoring form {cavrictu'a}. See also {carvi}, {rictu'a}.

column2: $m_1$ orders $m_2$ to have $c_2$ executed by action/method $c_3$.
column5: condemn to death;order execution;sentence to death

column2: $x_1$ is a hitman.
$cl_1$=$ci_1$ (misses / emotionally feels the lack of) $cl_2$=$ci_3$.
$x_1$ is sad that they lack $x_2$ (ka); $x_1$ misses $x_2$.
$x_1$ is barely $x_2$ (property of $x_1$); $x_1$ has barely / almost doesn't have property $x_2$
$x_1$ is an ellipsis character ("…")
$g_1$ (person/agent) deprives $c_1$ of $c_2$.
$r_1$=$g_1$ is a rainmaking/ ritual intended to invoke rain $r_2$=$g_2$, by custom/in community$r_3$, with form/rules$r_4$.
column3: Rainmaking is an ethnographic term for rituals intended to invoke rain. Raindancing (=lo nu cavgari'i dansu).

column2: $l_1$ (agent) showers $l_2$.
$x_1$ is a shower head/faucet/nozzle made of material $x_2$ with flow rate $x_3$ and water pressure $x_4$
column3: see {carvi} {lumci} {tutci} For sprinklers or other water tools use {cavytci}

column2: $f_1$ is a rain forest with trees $t_1$.
$x_1$ is a rainforest.
$f_1$=$c_1$, consisting of $f_2$,  pours into $f_3$=$c_2$ from $f_4$=$c_3$.
$k_1$ is a raincoat of material $k_2$, protecting from rain $c_1$.
$l_1$=$s_1$ (agent) showers itself of soil/contaminant $l_3$ with cleaning material(s) $l_4$.
$x_1$ actualizes $x_2$ (nu); $x_1$ makes $x_2$ actually happen; $x_1$ makes $x_2$ a reality
$f_1$ is actual (existing in act or reality, not just potentially).
$f_1$ is rotten/decayed/fermented with decay/fermentation agent $f_2$.
$x_1$ is currently/actively/actually (rather than latently/potentially/habitually) exhibiting property $x_2$ (ka).
$u_1$ is a slider in user interface $u_2$.
$x_{1}$ (mass) is a font interrelated by rules or relations $x_{2}$ among components $x_{3}$ (full set) displaying $x_{4}$ (property of $x_{1}$).
$x_1$ (li; tensor with units of $kg*m^2$) is the moment of inertia/angular inertial-mass/rotational inertia of object $x_2$ around axis/point of reference $x_3$ in basis/coordinate system $x_4$.
column3: Physics is all about expressing the same thing in different ways in order to gain new insight about it. There are other ways to express a mathematical quantity which is equivalent to this one (much as gravitational charge and inertial mass are mathematically mutually equal but not conceptually identical).

column2: $x_1$ is official, approved by $x_2$, an authority over $x_3$
$x_1$ is a voiceless postalveolar sibilant fricative sound produced by $x_2$.
column3: Derived from and synonymous with {cy zei sance}. The odd morphological form serves to place the most salient consonant in the stressed syllable.
column5: C sound;SH-sound;voiceless postalveolar sibilant;voiceless postalveolar sibilant fricative

column2: $x1$ pertains to Châtelperronian technological industry/culture/know-how of period and location (specifics) $x2$ in properties $x3$
$j_1$ is the bishop/archbishop of $j_2$ of religion $l_1$.
$x1$ pertains to/reflects Seanchan culture/nationality/geography in aspect $x2$
$x_1$ has ADHD, satisfying symptom(s) $x_2$ (ka).
$x_1$ is a quantity of shawarma containing $x_2$
$x_1$ is a game of chess between $x_2$ (white) and $x_3$ (black).
Rot-13.
Checkmate.
Shahnameh
column3: The Persian epic poem written by Ferdowsi ({la} {ferdoSIS}).

column2: elliptical/unspecified truth value; "maybe, maybe not"
column3: {cau'i}, but in NA. Indicates unspecificity or uncertainty between {ja'a} and {na}. See {cau'e}.

column2: begin lines of serial dialogue
column3: Usually, the user should immediately precede this word by ".{i}{ni'o}". This word introduces a dialogue or series of utterances/expressions, which will usually be unmarked for speaker (although subscripting is available), in a free-floating structure; the result is essentially like an assertion that the subsequent dialogue took place (from the standpoint of needing a selbri for a grammatical expression). Only quotations, text, "{sedu'u}" expressions, "{lu'e}" concepts or similar may be enclosed in the structure which is introduced by this word, ignoring subscripts and parentheticals and similar. The lines of dialogue which constitute the elements enclosed by the produced structure function as in and are serialized as described by the open-ended terbri tail of "{tcasnuue}" (id est: tcasnuue$_i$ for $i > 6$). Use this word in a transcript, or in a book when discussing fast-pased dialogue in which specifying speaker is not necessary/desired and would break the flow, etc. This word/the structure produced thereby is terminated by "{ca'u'o}". The structure is not intended to modify any other constructions and should typically be immediately followed by ".{i}{ni'o}".

column2: elliptical/unspecified scalar modifier: "maybe, maybe not", modifies next selbri-unit or tag
column3: {cau'i}, but in NAhE. Shortened from {cau'o'e}. See {cau'a}.

column2: modifier / discursive: elliptical affirmative; "maybe, maybe not"
column3: Elliptical NAI/CAI. "Maybe yes, maybe no, maybe somewhere in between". Can also modify attitudinals: {uicau'i} = "Maybe I'm happy, maybe I'm sad". See {ju'ocu'i}, {ju'acu'i}, {ju'oinai}, {cau'a}, {cau'e}, {na'i}, {ge'e}

column2: Terminate "ca'u'e" construct.
column3: Elidable terminator; seldom actually elidable in practice, except at the end of text. See: "{ca'u'e}".

column2: elliptical/vague/indecisive scalar affirmer/negator; true neutral/non-committed/uninvolved scalar truthfulness/assertion.
column3: Useful for when the truthfulness or falseness of a bridi is undesirable (the speaker makes no firm stance or assumption on the matter). Different from "{no'e}" in that it does not necessarily select a neutral value on a scale; it merely acknowledges that some value on the scale could be chosen/that the scale exists, but does not choose one (it is hands-off). If one does not want to accuse someone of being or doing something, but wants to talk about it, this word would be used; often can be used for "are or are not". It does not necessarily imply uncertainty or leading/implicit or rhetorical device/assertion/assumption/question.

column2: right now
column3: Narrows the scope/meaning of "now" to be relatively more immediate (but it still may encompass a small interval that extends into the objective/physical past and/or future).

column2: nowadays, wide sense of "now"
column3: The interval that is considered to be "now" by the speaker is relatively large(r).

column2: $x_{1}$ is an era/epoch/age characterized by $x_{2}$ (event/property/interval/idea).
column3: ($x_2$ interval should be the defining boundaries; if merely a characterizing period, the nature of the interval should be expressed in an abstract bridi, or the interval should be marked with tu'a; $x_2$ may also be characteristic object(s) or practices of the era, if marked with tu'a); See also {ranji}, {temci}, {citsi}.

column2: $x_{1}$ varies/changes in property/quantity $x_{2}$ (ka/ni) in amount/degree $x_{3}$ under conditions $x_{4}$.
column3: Non-resultative, not-necessarily causal change.  (cf. cenba which is non-resultative, galfi which is resultative and causal, stika which is non-resultative and causal; stodi, zasni, binxo)

column2: $x_{1}$ is holy/sacred to person/people/culture/religion/cult/group $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a hundredth [1/100; $10^{-2}$] of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_{1}$ is an heir to/is to inherit $x_{2}$ (object/quality) from $x_{3}$ according to rule $x_{4}$.
column3: Pedantically, inheriting an object should be a sumti-raising (tu'a if non-abstract in $x_2$) of inheriting loka ponse the object - the ownership of the object (= {posycerda}, {posyselcerda} for unambiguous semantics).  See also {jgina}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a morning [dawn until after typical start-of-work for locale] of day $x_{2}$ at location $x_{3}$.
column3: This morning (= {cabdeicerni}); tomorrow morning (= {bavlamcerni}); yesterday morning (= {prulamcerni}, {prulamdeicerni}) See also {vanci}, {murse}, {tcika}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is an expert/pro/has prowess in/is skilled at $x_{2}$ (event/activity) by standard $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the god/deity of people(s)/religion $x_{2}$ with dominion over $x_{3}$ [sphere]; $x_{1}$ is divine.
column3: Also divinity; $x_2$ religion refers to the religious community as a mass.  See also {censa}, {krici}, {lijda}, {malsi}.

column2: $x_{1}$ [state/event/process] commences/initiates/starts/begins to occur; (intransitive verb).
$x_{1}$ is a work of fiction about plot/theme/subject $x_{2}$/under convention $x_{2}$ by author $x_{3}$.
column3: Also story, lie, untrue.  See also {cukta}, {lisri}, {prosa}, {fatci}, {jitfa}, {jetnu}, {xanri}.

column2: $x_{1}$ (property - ka) is a flaw/fault/defect in $x_{2}$ causing $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a wedge [shape/form/tool] of material $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (event/state) confuses/baffles $x_{2}$ [observer] due to [confusing] property $x_{3}$ (ka).
$x_{1}$ is blood/vital fluid of organism $x_{2}$.
links terms into an afterthought termset.
digit/number: % percentage symbol, hundredths.
selbri variable assignment; assigns broda series pro-bridi to a selbri.
non-logical connective: ordered sequence link; "and then", forming a sequence.
pseudo-quantifier binding a variable within an abstraction that represents an open place.
digit/number: 3 (digit) [three].
$x_1$ is a group of people who love each other in a sexual or non-sexual way, which includes the individuals $x_2$, $x_3$, $x_4$, $x_5$, etc., etc., etc.
column3: The most common {celdi} is a couple, but the word also covers polyamorous collectives, polygyny, polyandry, etc. Could even cover {lanzu}. Proposed rafsi is -cle-.

column2: $x_1$ pertains to the Shinto culture/religion/ethos in aspect $x_2$
$x_1$ [dimensionful number] is the (relative) phase (difference) in oscillatory system $x_2$ relative to zero mark $x_3$ under conditions/by standard $x_4$
column3: Can be used for waves, pendula, track races, etc.

column2: $d_1$ desires/wants/wishes era $d_2$=$c_1$ (event/state) characterized by $c_2$ (event/property/interval/idea) for purpose $d_3$. $d_1$ is nostalgic.
column3: Typically refers to a desire for a past era, but can be used to describe a future era as well.

column2: $m_1$=$c_1$ is contemporary with/in the same epoch/era as $m_2$ by standard $m_3$ ($m_1$=$c_1$ and $m_2$ interchangeable).
$x_1$ is genetics (the science of heredity) based on methodology $x_2$ (proposition)
$k_1$ believes (without evidence/proof) that the god/deity $c_1$ exists.
$x_1$ is the incarnation/avatar of god $x_2$ of religion $x_3$
$d1$ does not know if a god(s) exist; d1 is agnostic.

$x_1$=$s_1$ is an idol/a sign/symbol representing god/demon/property $x_2$=$s_2$ to observer $x_3$=$s_3$
$z_1$ is the Heaven of religious community $c_2$.
$g_1$=$c_2$ is an arrow made of $g_2$ fired/launched by $c_1$.

$g_1$ (person/mass) attacks with a projectile weapon/shoots victim $g_2$ with goal/objective $g_3$ using launcher/gun $c_1$ which launches/fires/shoots projectile/missile $c_2$ propelled by propellant/propulsion $c_3$.
$x_1$ is December of year $x_2$ in calendar $x_3$.
$x_1$=$n_1$ is a firefight/gunfight/gun-battle/duel between combatants $x_2$=$d_1$ and $x_3$=$d_2$ over issue $x_4$=$d_3$ (abstract).
column3: {celxacnunda'a} is synonymous. For the classic pistol duel once common in Europe and the Americas, see {celkemvilnunjivna}/{celxackemvilnunjivna}.

column2: $xa_1$=$c_1$ is a gun/cannon/firearm for use against $xa_2$ by $xa_3$, launching projectile $c_2$ propelled by $c_3$.
column3: jvajvo; Gismu deep structure is "cecla gi'e xarci".

$s1$ pertains to community $s2$=$c2$

$l1$=$c1$ is $l2$ centiliter(s)/centilitre(s) [metric unit] in volume (default is 1) by standard $l3$
$d1$ is $d2$ full (centi)milidays (hundred-thousandth of a day unit) in duration (default is 1 (centi)miliday) by standard $d3$; d1 is a metric second.

$d_1$ is $d_2$ full centidays (hundredth of a day unit) in duration (default is 1 centiday) by standard $d_3$
column3: For use with metric time system.

column2: $x_1$ breakfasts on breakfast $x_2$
$m_1$=$c_1$ is the dawn of day $m_2$=$c_2$ at location $m_3$=$c_3$.
$ca_1$ is matutinal/active during the pre-dawn/early morning $ce_1$=$m_1$.

$s_1$ is hieralogy/science of/about sacreds/sacredness $c_1$=$s_2$ based on methodology $s_3$.
$s_1$=$c_1$ is a holy site to person/people/culture/religion/cult/group $c_2$.
$x_1$ is saintly/holy by moral standard/religion $x_2$
$cmene_1$ is a Divine Name of $cevni_1$=$cmene_2$ as known by $cevni_2$=$cmene_3$ which is associated with $cevni_3$; $cmene_1$ is a name of god.
$b_1$ is entirely in the future of $b_2$; $b_1$ begins after $b_2$.
$g_1$ notices $g_2$ by means $g_3$ under condition $g_4$=$c_1$.
$x_1$=$g_1$ (person/agent) initiates/begins/starts/causes the beginning of $x_2$=$c_1$ (state/event/process).
$p_1$ is preliminary to $c_1$=$p_2$'s beginning.
$r_1$ is/are the ritual/proceedings for starting/commencing $c_1$[event/state/process] by community $r_2$ with rules $c_4$.
$s_1$ realizes $s_2$ under condition $c_1$.
$s_1$ powers up $s_2$ for function $s_3$=$c_1$.
$x_1$ is the preamble/introduction to $x_2$
$x_1$ sits down on $x_2$.
column3: Cf. {co'a}, {cfari}, {zutse}, {nitytse}, {tsebi'o}. Simple {zutse} refers to the act of sitting, whereas cfatse means the act of beginning to sit.

column2: $x_1$ finds fault/flaw $x_2$ in $x_3$ (object/action), of which the flaw causes $x_4$
$x_1$ debugs $x_2$
$x_1$ finds fault/flaw $x_2$ in actions $x_3$ causing $x_4$; $x_1$ criticizes with critics $x_2$ action $x_3$
$t_1$=$c_1$ is a wedge (tool) of material $c_2$.
$v_1$ is a crowbar/nutpick for doing $v_2$, with fulcrum $v_3$, arm $v_4$, and pointed end $c_1$
column3: Any tool with a wedge on the end of a lever, normally with the fulcrum close to the wedge.

column2: $s_1$ diagnoses/proof-reads/searches/tests/debugs for flaw/property $c_1$=$s_2$ in $c_2$=$s_3$  causing $c_3$
$x_1$ is a "bug-list" / list of discovered flaws in $x_2$
$x_1$ criticizes $x_2$, pointing out flaws $x_3$.
$j_1$ is a writing desk of material $j_2$, supported by legs/base/pedestal $j_3$, used by writer $c_1$.
$f_1$=$c_1$ writes/authors $f_2$=$c_2$ for purpose $f_3$ from existing elements/ideas $f_4$.
$s_1$=$c_2$ is a secretary to $s_2$.
$t_1$ is a font/writing style used by $c_1$ to write $c_2$ on medium $c_3$ with implement $c_4$ under conditions $t_3$.
column3: {tadji} isn't exactly the right word. Deprecated in favor of {ci'artai}.

column2: $t_1$ is a font/writing style used by $c_1$ to write $c_2$ on medium $c_3$ with implement $c_4$.
$cu_1$=$ci_1$ expresses in writing $cu_2$=$ci_2$ for audience $cu_3$ using display/storage medium $ci_3$ with writing implement $ci_4$.
$x_1$ commits typo/writing error $x_2$
$x_1$ is a Wednesday of week $x_2$ on calendar $x_3$.
$c_1$ is trigonometry of triangle $j_1$.
$t_1$ is a triangle.
$d_1$ is a triangle (musical instrument).
$g_1$ is $g_2$ yard/yards (length unit).
$x_1$ is March/the third month of year $x_2$ in calendar $x_3$.
$x_1$ is March/the third month of year $x_2$ in calendar $x_3$.
$j_1$ has the rank of Major/Lieutenant Commander/Squadron Leader (equivalent of NATO OF-3) in military unit /organization $j_2$.
column3: Cf. {ci}, {moi}, {jatna}, {jemja'a}, {vairsoi}, {vonmoija'a}, {relmoija'a}.  Based on STANAG 2116: NATO Codes for Grades of Military Personnel.

column2: $xa_1$=$d_1$ is the middle finger of hand $xa_2$=$d_2$ attached to body $d_3$.
$x_1$ is a 3-dimensional vector with coordinates $x_2$, $x_3$ and $x_4$.
$x_1$ is a Wednesday evening of week $x_2$ in calendar $x_3$.
$x_1$ is the volume (3-dimensional space) occupied by $x_2$
$x_1$=$v_1$=$f_1$ is a stage 3 fu'ivla meaning $x_2$=$v_2$, based on word $x_3$=$f_2$ in language $x_4$.
column3: 'stage 3 fu'ivla' is a term specific to Lojban and described in 'The Complete Lojban Language', chapter 4, section 7. The definition is similar to that of {fu'ivla}, but with the x3 place of {fu'ivla} omitted. x1 is assumed to be a word in Lojban as the concept doesn't make much sense for other languages. See also {pavyfu'ivla} - 'stage 1 fu'ivla', {relfu'ivla} - 'stage 2 fu'ivla' and {vonfu'ivla} - 'stage 4 fu'ivla'

column2: $x_1$ (sound, text) is a triphthong.
$p_1$ is an upper secondary education diploma entitling $p_2$ to entitlement/privilege $p_3$ (event/state) from school/institute/academy $c_1$ teaching subject(s) $c_3$.
column3: Third level of International Standard Classification of Education (ISCED).

column2: $x_1$=$kr_3$ is a three-way intersection of roads $x_2$=$kr_1$=$kl_1$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of Citrus trifoliata [fruit/tree, etc.] of species/strain $x_{2}$.
$p_1$ is the third closest planet revolving around $p_2$, with planetary characteristics $p_3$, orbital parameters $p_4$.
$t_2$ is three-legged with legs $t_1$.
$v_1$ is a three-syllable word meaning $v_2$ in language $v_3$=$s_2$ with syllables $s_1$.
$x_1$ is three-legged.
$m_1$ is a tricycle (propelled, three-wheeled vehicle) carrying $m_2$ on surface $m_3$, propelled by $m_4$
column3: Explicitly implies a propelled vehicle. Parallels {relxilma'e}. {cibyselxi'u} merely refers to a "device".

column2: $f_1$ is an uncultivated field of material $f_2$.
$x_1$ is a wildcat
$x_1$ is sky-blue [color adjective].
$x_1$ is Thursday of week $x_2$ on calendar $x_3$.
$j_1$ is a turquoise (gem/polished stone) of type $j_2$ from source material $j_3$.
$k_1$ is/contains/is made from turquoise of type $k_2$, mined from location/lode/mine $k_3$.
$x_1$ is aqua [color adjective].
$x_1$ is the abstract color cyan
column3: The gismu {cicna} refers to objects which are cyan, but not the color cyan itself.  This lujvo serves the latter purpose.  See also {skari} {zilska}

column2: $x_1$ is a wild apple/crab apple of species/strain/cultivar $x_2$
$c_1$=$p_1$ is a savage/wild person.
$f_1$ is a jungle
$cr_1$ wildcrafts $cr_2$ from $cr_3$=$ci_1$.
$r_1$ is a hare of species $r_2$.
$x_1$ is wild rice of species/variety $x_2$.
$s_1$=$c_1$ is a weed of species $s_2$.
$f_{1}$ is a brush/shrubland [field of wild plants] with predominant plant species/cultivar $s_{2}$.
column3: Not neccessarily limited to bushes, this can refer to any expanses of land with wild plants. Cf {spafoi} (without the restriction to wild plants), {foldi}.

column2: $v_1$ weeds out plants $s_1$=$c_1$ of species $s_2$ from $v_3$ with/leaving result/remnant/remainder $v_4$.
$ca_1$=$ci_3$ crawls on surface $ca_2$.
column3: Cf. {cidni}, {cadzu}, {cidydzu}, {cidykla}, {reskla}. Similar to walking but without standing on feet.

column2: $t_1$ kneels on surface $t_2$ on limb $c_2$=$x_3$ of body $c_3$=$x_4$.
$x_1$ kneels/genuflects with meaning $x_2$ on surface $x_3$ on/with limb(s) $x_4$ of body $x_5$.
column3: Usually implies obeisance, homage, devotion, loyalty, obedience, subservience, vulnerability, or some other form of inferiority or trust. Specify the recipient of said inferiority or trust expression via/in $x_2$. Mere "{cidytse}" is an action which may not convey any semantic information; cidytsecorci refers to a strict/proper subset of actions which are cidytse. This word uses experimental rafsi "-coc-", which has been proposed to be assigned to experimental gismu "{corci}". This word is, for now, equivalent to "{cocyborcidytse}", mostly because .krtisfranks. cannot semantically distinguish between "a kneeling-type-of semantic-gesture" and "a semantic-gesture-type-of kneeling".

number: uncountably infinite of some sort or infinite in the sense of satisfying the Generalized Continuum Hypothesis.
column3: An infinite cardinality which is not countable (aleph-0); if the Generalized Continuum Hypothesis (GCH) is rejected, meaning that the only infinite cardinalities are those of aleph-n form (for nonnegative integer n), then this word would incorporate all uncountable infinities (aleph-m for any strictly positive integer m); else, it incorporates those and any infinity which is strictly larger than aleph-0.

column2: Digit string: aleph-nought, aleph-0, the cardinality of the natural (alternatively: integer) numbers
tense interval modifier: countably infinitely many times; objectively quantified tense; defaults as time tense.
column3: Not necessarily discrete or unbounded in time, nor (eventually or otherwise) infinitely frequent; as a set of Lebesgue measure 0, it is definitely not "always" ({roroi}) in most contexts. For a less specific form of "infinitely many times", use "{ci'iroi}". For the R type of uncountably infinitely many times, use "{ci'iparoi}".
